title: 1971 Portable Coleridge,
content:
One of my mother's books from college; I really like the font used on the cover. Pay no attention to the filled in counters on the front...you know you have books that look just like it.

Peace,  
JT

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20131013134214im_/http:/typophile.com/files/coleridge_5175.jpg)
author: jt_the_ninja

comments.content:
Should be Trajanus, digitized as Tribunus  
 [http://new.myfonts.com/fonts/spiecegraphics/tribunus-sg/](http://web.archive.org/web/20131013134214/http:/new.myfonts.com/fonts/spiecegraphics/tribunus-sg/ "http://new.myfonts.com/fonts/spiecegraphics/tribunus-sg/")  
or Hadrianus  
 [http://new.myfonts.com/fonts/scriptorium/hadrianus/](http://web.archive.org/web/20131013134214/http:/new.myfonts.com/fonts/scriptorium/hadrianus/ "http://new.myfonts.com/fonts/scriptorium/hadrianus/")

(both with a larger counter on the "e")

p.s.  
the other font (back cover) is Weiss

Ah! Thanks a lot. :)

Peace,  
JT
